Gained business exposures in different countries during the years, I managed to leverage on my expertise and skills in diverse working environments and cultural backgrounds.

In Beijing, I interned as an investment banking summer analyst at CITIC Securities, the largest full-service Chinese investment bank.

At CITIC, I 

·	Assisted Financial Institution Group (FIG) of one of the largest domestic investment banks in China, for the largest-ever private placement project in China A-Share market - Agricultural Bank of China (100 billion RMB issued)

·	Initiated industry research, reviewed announcements during issuance process, collected stock market information and authored 3 stock market analysis reports during issuance process for decision-making of senior management

·	Facilitated due diligence, documentation and continuous supervision fieldwork of Private Placement of Hainan Haide plc, organised working paper catalogue and created the documentation archive for the whole project (1000+ pages)

·	Established database of shareholder structure and financial summary of 40+ domestic asset management companies, coordinated background check of 11 potential clients in prepare for potential projects with approaching IPO clients

·	Created financial spreadsheet models, collected data and analysed relevant information using accounting, financial and legal knowledge, Bloomberg terminal and Wind Database and other finance resources

In Oxford, I worked as a part-time student editor for the accounting group of OUP (Oxford University Press).

I contributed by doing the following for OUP 

·	Performed reviews of new editions of accounting textbooks, arranged accounting student interviews and questionnaire distribution; Drafted essay samples for accounting research books to be published

·	Completed practice question designing, written feedback report of new sections and ongoing researches
